title: Celery Root And Potato Mash
summary: Celery Root And Potato Mash might be just the Southern recipe you are searching for. This recipe serves 10 and costs 52 cents per serving. One portion of this dish contains about 4g of protein, 5g of fat, and a total of 157 calories. 3 people have made this recipe and would make it again. It works well as a side dish. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 25 minutes. Head to the store and pick up celery leaves, celery root, butter, and a few other things to make it today. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and vegetarian diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 34%. This score is not so outstanding. Try Potato and Celery Root Mash, Celery Root & Potato Mash, and Celery Root and Potato Mash for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Southern works really well with Riesling, Sparkling Wine, and Zinfandel. In general, there are a few rules that will help you pair wine with southern food. Food-friendly riesling or sparkling white wine will work with many fried foods, while zinfandel is great with barbecued fare. The Weingut Schneider Niederhauser Hermannshohle Riesling Trocken with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 30 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Weingut Schneider Niederhauser Hermannshohle Riesling Trocken
productMatches.description: Smoky aromas lead into a palate that’s incredibly silky, salty and articulate; cherry blossom and scree in ultra hi-def; a delicate nip of chile-thread on the finish doesn’t obtrude on the cool breezy complexity. I don’t remember a better vintage of this wine.
